Name: Two Shawabti Figures of Thuya
Description: A shawabti is a statuette that will perform work in place of the deceased in the underworld. Both of these gilded wooden statuettes are in the shape of a mummy, depicting Thuya with her arms crossed on her chest and her hands protruding from her garments. The figures wear necklaces ending with Horus heads. Hieroglyphic text from the sixth spell of the Book of the Dead and the name of Thuya is written around the statuettes.
